M01.name: The Token
M01.description: The Primus wants bodies in the sand before the midday crowd thins. You're first on the slate — cheap entertainment for an indifferent house. Nobody expects much. Use that.

M02.name: Blood Contract
M02.description: A cloaked broker offers gold for a job with no name. The alley smells like a trap, the terms smell like a trap, and the broker's eyes move like a man who has done this before. Your debts don't care about any of that. As you negotiate, a drunk man leans against the far wall, muttering in the sour language of lost money — something about ruined odds, about fighters who don't stay down when they're supposed to. His eyes find yours for a moment, sharp through the wine. 'Enjoy the crowd's love while it lasts,' he says. 'The house always balances its books.'

investigation_clue.text: Drunk man muttering about lost money and ruined odds after Cassian's wins — bitter, specific, personal

investigation_ledger.event: A drunk man warns the house always balances its books — first hint that records and debts matter to powerful people

M03.name: Gladiator Debt
M03.description: A former champion sends word through a mutual contact. The favor is old — you didn't think he remembered it. He remembers everything. Fight or pay what you owe. There is no third option he's willing to discuss. Before the bout, the old champion leans in close, voice low enough that only you hear: 'I've seen a hundred fighters come through here. That yellow coward Lucius used to be worth watching — real talent once. Now he avoids anyone who might actually beat him. Bets on the outcome instead of fighting. Feeds on the crowd's memory of what he used to be.' He spits. 'You should know who else is watching you rise.'

investigation_clue.text: Old champion names Lucius as a coward who avoids real fighters and bets on outcomes instead

M04.name: The Lanista
M04.description: The Lanista doesn't summon people twice. She owns the arena, the contracts, the debts that keep fighters compliant — and she wants a conversation. She won't explain what about. She doesn't have to. What she does say, at the edge of dismissal, stays with you: 'I have eyes on the ridge. I have people everywhere. Varro runs my networks — he keeps the numbers straight, knows who owes what to whom, knows which records would ruin which men if they surfaced. He's loyal because loyalty keeps him alive. Remember that the next time you wonder if you're being watched.'

investigation_clue.text: Lanista says Varro runs her networks — controls information, keeps records of who owes what to whom

investigation_ledger.event: Lanista references Varro's record-keeping — powerful people track debts and secrets, and those records have real value

M05.name: The Shrine Fracture
M05.description: A wounded priest needs safe passage to the ridge shrine before whoever put three knife wounds in him finishes the job. The ridge road is Cult territory — they're watching for exactly this kind of errand. You'll be visible the entire way. At the shrine, you meet Iona and the boy called Moth. But before you leave, you feel eyes from the colonnade — an older woman standing apart from the other priests, watching you specifically. She doesn't speak. She doesn't need to. She's cataloguing something about you, deciding whether you are a danger or a tool.

investigation_clue.text: An older woman watches from the shrine colonnade, evaluating Cassian with deliberate, institutional attention

M06.name: The State's Eye
M06.description: Two State agents have been following you for four days. They're not subtle — they want you to know. That means they're either very confident or under orders to be visible. Either way, the decision is yours: run, talk, or make them regret the assignment. What becomes clear as you plan is that someone else has been watching both you and the State agents. The surveillance has its own shadow. You don't know who. You only know that if the State is watching you, someone else is already watching the State.

investigation_clue.text: Someone watches both Cassian and the State agents — surveillance has its own unseen layer

M07.name: Underground Market
M07.description: Beneath the docks, in the part of Port City that doesn't appear on any official map, there's a market that operates on a different economy. Rare goods, rare debts, rare opportunities. The risks are priced accordingly. The man who runs this floor, Corvus, speaks like someone who has survived by knowing things. 'Good fighters come here,' he says. 'Bad fighters disappear. There's talk of a book — names, debts, corruption trails — worth more than gold to the right hands. Varro's network has a hand in everything that moves through here; information is the real currency. The Priestess has people watching too. Faith is its own economy. Everybody's watching somebody.'

investigation_clue.text: Corvus confirms Varro's network controls information flow through the black market — he knows who holds what
Corvus confirms the Priestess has people watching the black market — the cult monitors all power flows

investigation_ledger.event: Corvus mentions talk of a book containing names, debts, and corruption trails — it has value to anyone who can read it

M08.name: The Dread Pact
M08.description: The shadow faction doesn't announce itself. It presents a set of arrangements, a mutual understanding, an implied future where certain doors stay open. Accept their terms and certain things become possible that weren't before. What becomes impossible is something they'll explain later. A shadowed voice, near the end of the meeting: 'There's something being held by someone in this city. A ledger. Names, figures — the kind of record-keeping that would redraw alliances and unmake power. We've heard whispers. We're interested in whoever holds it. If you hear anything, remember we pay well for that kind of information.'

investigation_ledger.event: Shadow faction explicitly states a ledger would redraw alliances and unmake power — all factions are hunting it

M09.name: Varro's Trial
M09.description: Varro tests things before he trusts them. The ambush on the ridge road is a test — one that could get you killed if you don't understand that in time. Survive it without hating him for it and you might have the most valuable ally in the city. When the men step back and Varro himself appears, he watches you with the patience of a man who has been watching for a while. 'You carry more than a blade,' he says. 'Something close. Something that makes people nervous.' He pauses. 'That's either bravery or desperation. I need to know which before I decide what you are to me.'

investigation_clue.text: Varro directly confronts Cassian — knows his movements, senses he carries something valuable and dangerous

investigation_ledger.event: Varro implies Cassian carries something close — someone with networks now suspects the ledger's location

M10.name: The First Reckoning
M10.description: Every debt you've run up, every favor you've called in, every enemy you've made — they've all arrived at the same hour. This is what the point of no return actually feels like. Less dramatic than you expected. More final. In the stands: a man who has been losing money on your wins, watching with the specific attention of someone who has nothing left to lose. At the perimeter: a silhouette that knows your schedule better than you do. At the colonnade: a woman who has been deciding whether you are a danger or a tool and has now made her decision. All of them are watching. You no longer exist in the shadows.

investigation_clue.text: Lucius watches from the stands with precise, predatory attention — Cassian's rise is his financial ruin
The Priestess watches from the colonnade — Cassian is no longer invisible to the cult's institutional eye

investigation_ledger.event: All three rivals and multiple factions present simultaneously — Cassian's anonymity is permanently broken

M11.name: The Arena Rises
M11.description: The Lanista opens the grand arena for the season's main program. Every rival with ambitions and every patron with influence has a seat. This is the bout that separates the fighters who are remembered from the ones who are replaced.

hazard.name: Blood on the Sand
hazard.summary: Arena sand is salted with shards; both sides take 1 true damage each round.

M12.name: Syndicate Notice
M12.description: The Syndicate doesn't threaten in words. They send two men to stand outside your door at noon and not leave until evening. The message is the men. Pay the tribute or become a different kind of lesson for the next person who doesn't.

M13.name: The Ridge Passage
M13.description: The ridge route has been blocked for three seasons by bandits with Cult connections. Everyone who needs it open has been waiting for someone else to pay the cost of opening it. You're the someone else.

M14.name: Varro's Offer
M14.description: Varro has been running a network of informants, sympathisers, and discreet creditors for longer than you've been fighting. He's willing to offer you access. Walk away and he remains neutral. Walk away wrong and he becomes something else.

M15.name: The Cult Demands
M15.description: The high priest of the shrine network arrives in person, which means the demand is significant enough that he didn't trust a messenger. Refuse and the Cult becomes an active obstacle. Comply and you inherit both their faith and their enemies.

M16.name: State Crackdown
M16.description: The State crackdown comes without warning, which means someone tipped them off and that someone knows your schedule. The district is locked down, the usual exits are watched. You have three options and none of them are clean.

M17.name: The Shadow War
M17.description: Two shadow factions have decided that the dock district is worth bleeding over. Their war has no regard for the people who live and work in it. You're in the middle by geography. Choosing a side means inheriting their enemies. Fighting both means inheriting everyone's.

M18.name: Debt Collectors
M18.description: Your creditors have run out of patience and hired the kind of men who don't negotiate. Pay the debt in full today — every coin, no extensions — or the negotiation happens differently. They've done this before. So have you.

M19.name: The Lanista's Gambit
M19.description: The Lanista has laid her entire position on this match — her contracts, her standing with the State, her ownership of the arena itself. She's not explaining why. She's asking you to win, and she's asking without the usual leverage, which means she's out of it. This is what trust looks like from her.

M20.name: End of Season One
M20.description: The season closes on a single bout that has taken three acts to arrive at. Everything that happened before was the prelude. The arena is full, the bets are placed, and the story is in its final chapter. What you do in the next hour will be what people say happened for the rest of their lives.

S01.name: Syndicate Recruitment
S01.description: Moth finds you before the docks clear out. She doesn't waste words. 'You handled yourself down there. We noticed. The Syndicate doesn't hire people — we test them first.' The job is straightforward on the surface: collect a debt from a local who has been dodging payment for three months. The man is not dangerous in the way fighters are dangerous — he's dangerous in the way cornered people are dangerous, with nothing left to lose and every reason to make this difficult. You're being watched on this errand. Not by the debtor. By whoever sent you. Do it clean, do it quiet, don't ask what the debt was originally for. That's the whole test. The money isn't the point. Proving you can be useful — and discreet — is.

investigation_clue.text: Moth personally recruits Cassian for Syndicate work — she's been watching, she chose this moment deliberately

S14.name: Lucius's Challenge
S14.description: He corners you near the fighters' gate, and there's nothing professional about the way he's standing. Lucius looks like a man who has been making bad decisions for so long he no longer recognizes them as decisions. 'I've been watching you,' he says. 'Everyone's been watching you. Odds are perfect right now — everyone thinks you're untouchable. I've lost everything on better odds than this.' He wants a duel. No official record. No witnesses that matter. Just the kind of fight that settles something personal before the city decides what you are. He's not wrong that something is unsettled — he's been losing money on your wins for months. Whether you owe him anything for that is a different question. He's asking you to answer it with a fight. How you answer will follow you.

investigation_clue.text: Lucius directly confronts Cassian — desperate, cornered, his entire financial ruin tied to Cassian's success

S02.name: The Lanista's Errand
S02.description: The Lanista has an errand that she can't assign to anyone on her official payroll. No questions, no written record, no witnesses who aren't already compromised. She's asked you specifically, which means she's either testing you or she's run out of people she trusts.

S06.name: The Pilgrim Guard
S06.description: A group of pilgrims needs safe passage to the ridge shrine. They're unarmed, they're slow, and the ridge road has been dangerous since the bandit factions moved in. Someone has to walk beside them, and they've asked in the name of their god, which is the kind of ask that costs you nothing to fulfill and everything to refuse.

S13.name: Shrine Debt
S13.description: The shrine priests have sent a formal request for protection — formal, because they understand that asking a fighter for help requires acknowledging that their faith isn't sufficient armor. They're right about that. You respect the honesty of it.
